    Case Studies Summary Case Study: Highly Parallel Genome-wide Expression Profiling of Individual Cells Using Nanoliter Droplets Case Study: Single-Cell RNA Sequencing Maps Endothelial Metabolic Plasticity in Pathological Angiogenesis Case Study: Single-cell Transcriptome Atlas of the Human Corpus Cavernosum Case Study: Single cell transcriptomics of human epidermis identifies basal stem cell transition states Case Study: The myogenesis program drives clonal selection and drug resistance in rhabdomyosarcoma Case Study: Expansion of Fcγ Receptor IIIa-Positive Macrophages, Ficolin 1-Positive Monocyte-Derived Dendritic Cells, and Plasmacytoid Dendritic Cells Associated With Severe Skin Disease in Systemic Sclerosis Case Study: Defining Transcriptional Signatures of Human Hair Follicle Cell States Case Study: The immune cell atlas of human neuroblastoma Case Study: A Single-Cell Transcriptomic Atlas of Human Skin Aging Case Study: Single-cell transcriptomic and proteomic analysis of Parkinson’s disease brains Case Study: A Single-Cell Characterization of Human Post-implantation Embryos Cultured In Vitro Delineates Morphogenesis in Primary Syncytialization Case Study: A human breast atlas integrating single-cell proteomics and transcriptomics Case Study: Single-cell RNA-seq reveals cell type-specific molecular and genetic associations to lupus Case Study: Single nucleus RNA-sequencing defines unexpected diversity of cholinergic neuron types in the adult mouse spinal cord Case Study: Robust temporal map of human in vitro myelopoiesis using single-cell genomics Case Study: Mapping the developing human immune system across organs

Case Study: A Single-Cell Characterization of Human Post-implantation Embryos Cultured In Vitro Delineates Morphogenesis in Primary Syncytialization

Kayla Interdonanto

Roswell Park Comprehensive Cancer Center
Kayla.Morrell@RoswellPark.org

31 October 2022

Source: vignettes/hca-9ac53858-606a-4b89-af49-804ccedaa660.Rmd
hca-9ac53858-606a-4b89-af49-804ccedaa660.Rmd

Setup

Load useful packages

library(hcaCaseStudies)
library(hca)
library(dplyr)

Project information

Set the project id

project_id <- "9ac53858-606a-4b89-af49-804ccedaa660"

Display information about the project

project_information(project_id)
## Title
##   A Single-Cell Characterization of Human Post-implantation Embryos
##   Cultured In Vitro Delineates Morphogenesis in Primary
##   Syncytialization
## Contributors (unknown order; any role)
##   Xiangxiang Jiang, Rachel Schwartz
## Description
##   We performed single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) analysis of human
##   post-implantation trophoblast cells. A hierarchical model was
##   established, which was characterized by the sequential and stepwise
##   development of two primitive cytotrophoblast cell (pCTB) subtypes
##   after the trophectoderm (TE), two primitive syncytiotrophoblast
##   (pSTB) subtypes, and migrative trophoblast cells (MTB). Further
##   analysis characterized a new subtype of fusion-competent cells, which
##   not only prepare for fusion to form primitive syncytiotrophoblast but
##   also possess migration ability, which could be dual-function cells
##   during implantation. Our work allows for reconstruction of sequential
##   trophoblast cell transcriptional programs transition during
##   implantation and provides a valuable resource to study pathologies in
##   early pregnancy, such as recurrent implantation failure.
## DOI
##   10.3389/fcell.2022.835445
## URL
##   https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fcell.2022.835445/full
## Project
##   https://data.humancellatlas.org/explore/projects/9ac53858-606a-4b89-af49-804ccedaa660

Conventions

Statistics calculated locally use local.* for column names, e.g., local.cellCount.

Data processing

Project & samples

Create a filter to identify the project

project_filter <- filters(projectId = list(is = project_id))

Find the project

p <- projects(project_filter, as = "tibble_expanded")
p |> glimpse()

Samples associated with the project

s <- samples(project_filter, as = "tibble_expanded")

Columns are either variable and therefore describe sample-level information…

## informative 'specimen' or 'donorOrganisms' columns
s |>
    select(starts_with("specimens") | starts_with("donorOrganisms")) |>
    select(where(column_is_informative)) |>
    glimpse()
## Rows: 19
## Columns: 2
## $ specimens.id      <chr> "HS092", "HS122", "HS105", "HS123", "HS103", "HS081"…
## $ donorOrganisms.id <chr> "embryo5", "embryo11", "embryo8", "embryo11", "embry…

…or invariant and reflect experiment-wide annotation

s |>

    distinct() |>
    glimpse()

Data files

What types of files does the project have?

files1 <- files(project_filter)

files1 |>
    glimpse()
## Rows: 40
## Columns: 8
## $ fileId       <chr> "2eed0a15-db7a-4930-96f3-d9617451e571", "2fec1f1f-7bdb-42…
## $ name         <chr> "SRR12475312_R2.fastq.gz", "SRR12475297_R2.fastq.gz", "GS…
## $ fileFormat   <chr> "fastq.gz", "fastq.gz", "csv.gz", "fastq.gz", "fastq.gz",…
## $ size         <dbl> 3236706705, 4106964134, 4476, 3353774754, 4029012475, 340…
## $ version      <chr> "2022-08-26T19:19:35.285000Z", "2022-08-26T19:19:34.75000…
## $ projectTitle <chr> "A Single-Cell Characterization of Human Post-implantatio…
## $ projectId    <chr> "9ac53858-606a-4b89-af49-804ccedaa660", "9ac53858-606a-4b…
## $ url          <chr> "https://service.azul.data.humancellatlas.org/repository/…

files1 |>
    count(fileFormat)
## # A tibble: 2 × 2
##   fileFormat     n
##   <chr>      <int>
## 1 csv.gz         2
## 2 fastq.gz      38

## create `files2` with just the files needed for count-matrix
## analysis

files2 <- files1 |>
    filter(fileFormat == "csv.gz")

Retrieve and cache locally all files needed to construct a gene x cell count matrix.

file_path <-
    files2 |>
    files_download() |>
    setNames(files2 |> pull(name))

## join file path to appropriate components of `f`
count_matrix_files1 <-
    files2 |>
    left_join(tibble(
        fileId = files2$fileId,
        local.filePath = unname(file_path)
    ), by = "fileId")

We can extract some data from the files, e.g., cell and gene counts

## 'files' is the final, locally modified, version of file data
count_matrix_files <-
    count_matrix_files1 |>
    filter(name == "GSE156456_HETR1014-matrix.csv.gz") |>
    cell_count_csv() |>
    gene_count()

count_matrix_files |>
    select(name, local.geneCount, local.cellCount)
## # A tibble: 1 × 3
##   name                             local.geneCount local.cellCount
##   <chr>                                      <int>           <int>
## 1 GSE156456_HETR1014-matrix.csv.gz           25742            1014

Count matrix

Create a dgCMatrix sparse matrix (defined in the Matrix package). Save it in the package cache for re-use across R sessions.

object_name <- "local.countMatrix"
if (!cache_exists(project_id, object_name)) {
    count_matrix_files |>
        count_matrix_csv() |>
        cache_add(project_id, object_name)
}
count_matrix <- cache_read(project_id, object_name)

class(count_matrix)[1] # sparse matrix
## [1] "dgCMatrix"
dim(count_matrix)      # genes x cells
## [1] 25742  1014
format(object.size(count_matrix), units = "auto")
## [1] "74.5 Mb"

Row, sample, and cell annotations

We don’t have any information on row (gene) data.

row_data <- tibble()

Column (sample & cell) data

sample_data <-
    ## from the hca sample annotation...
    s |>
    select(
        where(column_is_informative) & where(is.atomic)
    )
    ## ...and local computations, e.g.,gene and cell counts

sample_data

## #   ⁶​specimens.id
meta <- readr::read_csv(file_path[1])
## New names:
## Rows: 1014 Columns: 4
## ── Column specification
## ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── Delimiter: "," chr
## (3): ...1, stage, sample dbl (1): cluster
## ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. ℹ
## Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
## • `` -> `...1`
cellNames <- meta |>
    pull("...1") |>
    strsplit(":")

sampleIds <- cellNames |>
    vapply(head, character(1), 1L)
barcodes <- cellNames |>
    vapply(tail, character(1), 1L)

cell_data <-
    bind_cols(meta, local.sampleIds = sampleIds, local.barcodes = barcodes)

cell_data
## # A tibble: 1,014 × 6
##    ...1            stage sample cluster local.sampleIds local.barcodes

Experiment-wide metadata 

sample_metadata <-
    s |>
    select(where(column_is_experimentwide) & !any_of(names(p))) |>
    distinct()

metadata <- bind_cols(p, sample_metadata)

metadata |>
    glimpse()

Anomalies

The metadata file contains stage and cluster with no additional information. This makes it difficult to know how to map to entries in hca.
